Milli Re: 95 Years of Leadership and Contribution
Founded in 1929 to nationalize Türkiye’s insurance market, Milli Re is one of the world’s oldest reinsurance companies. As the world’s first and only privately owned company that managed a compulsory reinsurance system across all lines of business, Milli Re has played a pivotal role in shaping and advancing the insurance industry in Türkiye. Milli Re has also managed major reinsurance pools and was instrumental in establishing the Turkish Catastrophe Insurance Pool (TCIP/DASK), serving as its manager from 2000 to 2005. Following the termination of the compulsory reinsurance system, the Company redefined its strategic goals, focusing on expansion into international markets. In line with this vision, the Company opened its Singapore Office in 2007. Milli Re today continues to be the leading reinsurer of the Turkish Market, while providing capacity and risk mitigating solutions to its international clients as a prestigious and trusted reinsurer. In this connection, the Company plays a critical role in the insurance market by offering reinsurance protection to insurance companies, enhancing their capacity to underwrite policies, enabling them to manage their exposures and facilitating their claims handling procedures.
Beyond its core reinsurance operations, Milli Re has also been pioneering in the development of the insurance industry through initiatives such as the Turkish Insurance Institute Foundation and Reasürör Magazine, a quarterly academic publication featuring research, interviews and statistical analyses on re/insurance since 1991.
Committed to sustainable growth, innovation and social responsibility, Milli Re also organizes industry events such as the International Insurance Tennis Tournament and fosters cultural engagement through its art gallery and chamber orchestra.
Our workforce is our greatest asset.
